reviews.review_msg: Interesting teaching style -- engages lecture class in dialogue, similar to Socratic method. Obviously very intelligent person, also feminist (at least by my perceptions). TA's definitely a useful supplement to her lectures. you'll need to study in this course!

Tests are hard and unfair. She tests you on irrelevant material to the course context. Dry and heaving readings. Her lecture notes were neat though. Just read the text and you should do fine. If you need to take this course, do not take it with her, there are other profs that are much easier than she is.
No Comments

This is one of the most unorganized profs i have had.  The exams are not designed to test your knowledge about the subject. She doesnt post up web notes while wasting your time putting up notes directly from the text up and takes forever to get through a chapter... hmmm i wonder why?

It's an easy class - so take it is you need to boost your GPA or you need credit hours. However, if you are now a fan of feminism then prepare to suffer - she stands up and will accuse all men of being****s! And I have no idea where she gets some of her stats - they are absolutly ridiculous!
best prof ever.
i really liked the prof, thought she was excellent and very interested in what she was teaching.

heavy accent, her MC are very tricky, you have to understand the material really well, must attend and write very fast notes in lecture, cuz she goes thru material fast, and she doesn't write things down.some questions are based on lecture
femenazi  mc tests are super easy though - just remember blame everything on the straight white male

Course is great, quite easy. Atasoy has a heavy accent though. But you get used to it. The films shown are cool. MC tests are kind of tricky (double negatives & the occational all / some(eg. A&B) / none of the above.

Interesting course, worth taking if only just for the 4 credit hours. Prof was horrible. Lectures were directly out of the textbook, all tests were multiple choice, nothing interesting was added to lecture. If you take Atasoy's course, bring a pillow.

OH MAN WAT RU PEOPLE SAYING! Sociology is the only class i reallly looked forward to going. There aren't that many profs that are dynamic and funny. She was great, and she made 2 hours go by quickly.  The films we saw rocked. And my T.A rocked too.
overall...i really like this course...i like what i learnt... the prof is excellent although i do not agree that m/cs are the best way to evaluate students...her questions sometimes are ODD...
The prof has a great personality and brings lots of energy into class. The course itself interweaves materials from vast different diciplines. Her test is very easy and relevant.
awful...tests were disgusting and the answers to the questions were wrong and unclear..avoid her...course itself is great though...
shes not bad, hard to follow nice interesting woman though
very self absorbed. not innovative ie. lectures are straight from the text book. but her tests are super easy.
Disorganized
her exams are easy, but her lectures are messed up and hard to follow
Loved her!!  She's really funny...in a stupid way.  Her first impression is not always great. I would definately take her again.
No Comments
She is very helpful and freindly. She knows what she is talking about. She is a great prof and a great person to learn from.
No Comments
Very difficult to understand, very strong accent. She DOES laugh at her own joes and she messes with the microphone so that there is a lot of feedback.
Avoid class if you're male. Contrary opinions are NOT welcomed
No Comments
She tend to stereotype people and offend them accident i guess...~  I agree about the part where she laughs at her own jokes!
No Comments
good person and class...clarity is another matter.
No Comments
!!!  A difficult teacher to understand.
fun class! prof giggles at everything, fair tests, laid back lectures
Hahaha just sit back and laugh!
she knows her stuff - passionate and interesting
she gigles at things you can't understand
she is hilarious to watch and learn from
No Comments
